page.title: 01Hill Area NW Achaghraid
page.content: This hilly area once used as upland grazing for sheep is now almost entirely given over to coniferous plantations, both Forestry Commission and privately owned. The area has been cut into by the Inverneil Burn running NW to SE. In its upper asin the burn is a meandering stream but about 1/2 miles above the point whre it crosses under the B8024 road it enters a deep sided gorge. This section is a SSSI a site of special scientific importance. The Inverneil (or Achabhead) Bridge is said to be the highest above stream leve in Argyll, it was built in the 1840's as part of the constructin of the new Inverneil Hill Road. The morsoleum in square 12 is the private mansoleum of the Campbells of Inverneil who owned this land from 1776 to some time in 1950's. There are remains of old lead mines in area.
